title: Delicious local meals
text:
Very delicious local meals in a very nicely decorated restaurant.
They serve food tables and or you can choose to sit on floor to eat.

title: Nice Cafe and Book Shop
text: If you are walking in Salim street, then it worths paying a visit to this cafe to have a cup of tea or coffee and to read or buy some books.

title: Old cemetery
text: Called Zoroastrian cemetery or Baba Shaswar cemetery, located on the to Baba Shaswar water dam, is an old cemetery and worth visiting.

title: Beautiful old palace
text:
Beautifully decorated nineteenth century palace that belonged to Majeed Pasha Baban.
One side of the building is still standing and there are beautifully decorated walls.

title: Kimash Old Hamam and Gallery
text: Easy walk to visit this beautiful small old Hamam located close to old town of Kifri and now serves as a gallery.

title: Saray Kifri
text: Located in the western part of the city, built by British mandatory authorities in 1919 AD. Served as a court and other government departments till late 1970s

title: Dakhma Tombs
text: These located north to Kifri town, some are dating back to Zoroastrian times and some are nineteenth century tombs. They are located as rooms and are probably for families.

title: Beautiful Old Castle
text:
Located on the south suburbs of Kalar town, lies this castle that was built by Muhammad Pash Beg of Jaff (1866-1874) as a center of his tribe.
It’s octagonal in shape and consists of a basement and two floors with many nicely decorated rooms and now they serve as a museum.
The hill probably served as a garrison or a tower in older times as some excavation revealed different historical levels of Islamic (Umayyid and Abbasid) and Sassanids.
Easy to reach and walk around.

title: Town Cultural Museum
text:
An old post office building of the city transformed by locals to a beautiful cultural museum where old items of agricultural, photography, fabrics and industrial tools are exhibited.
Worth visiting.

title: Beautiful old water-mill
text: Built in early nineteenth century on the edge of Bawa Shaswar water stream. This beautiful old water-mill consists of few rooms and the chamber where water was allowed in to precess wheat, barley and rice.

title: Ancient architect
text:
This is considered to be one of the biggest stores in the region built in Ottoman style dating back to nineteenth century.
It was considered as city center market and contained more than 200 shops and few hotels.
Unfortunately now it’s ruins and neglected.

title: Wasta Rajab Cannon
text: During the rule of Mir Muhammad Pashai Gawra (1813-1837 A.D.), a factory was founded in Rawanduz city in Erbil to manufactore weapons and ammunitions under the supervision of Wasta Rajab. The latter who was sent to France to learn about this subject and later designed and supervised the manufacturing of cannons. He made 222 cannons in three different sizes of which the largest was accomplished in 1823 A.D. The cannon pictured below is 1.5 meters long. Some of Wasta Rajab's cannons are on exhibit at Baghdad museum. The cannon was named after its inventor, and is therefore called the "Wasta Rajab" cannon.

title: Must visit location
text:
Gomi Felaw, along Hamilton road, located opposite to Choman town in Sakran area, is a very beautiful scenery location where you can hike or camp around.
We visited it in December but highly recommended to visit it in April or May (spring times).

title: Very beautiful scenery
text:
Kharand valley, located at 980 m, Kharand is a natural site located west of Rawanduz on the road to Soran. The road section within the village of Kawlokan is named Kali Kharand while the section lying to the side of Rawanduz is called Kharand. A visit is highly recommended to see this stunning scenery!
Find the emoji or the face looking shape on the rocks.

title: Interesting to see
text:
Eej Castle located on a high hill between Rawanduz and Soran area, is a fortification built by King Mohammed (Pasha) of Rawanduz in early 17th century.
Most of it’s walls destroyed during Othoman invasion of the area.
There is a standing wall now and few bunkers or storage places.
Interesting to see if you are in Rawanduz area.

title: Kollaka Bardina Cave
text:
Kollaka Bardina Cave is a beautiful cave located close to Hajitan village in Piramagrun mountain. We hike to it in a sunny autumn day and reached comfortably the cave in 2 and half hours but preferably to go with a guide as there are no sight marks and you can easily loose your way in these vast mountains and valleys. Once you enter, it has several routes inside, go to the right side one and you can continue excursion until you reach some little water pond inside the cave. We spent one and half hours inside while taking lots of photos.
Wish you all a safe journey.

title: Beautiful mountains and waterfalls
text: We visit this nice place in early November, Autumn season, where was full of these beautiful pomegranate, walnuts and pears trees. Easy to medium hiking. 2 and half hours from Suly city by car. Temperature is cooler here. Locals are nice and sharing lots of different types of fruits with you.

title: Hidden jewelry of Penjwin town
text:
This beautiful place is indeed the hidden jewelry of Penjwin town, it’s around 25 minutes away by driving from Penjwin town or 2 hours away by driving from Suly city.
Very nice to hike around and go to this place for breathtaking scenes and swimming. It’s nice to visit it in spring or summer or autumn seasons. Considered colder place than Suly by around 5 C.

title: Good hotel and service
text:
A good hotel to stay and I was impressed by their good service especially the room service.
Weather was perfect as it is Autumn now.
Breakfast buffet was good. We also liked some other dishes Salmon, barbecues and Indian food.
There are interesting water sorts to do from the hotel, and I liked they had good quality boats and water vests. They have also kayaking and jet ski.
Highly recommend to visit if you are around.

title: Beautiful mountainous area
text:
Highly recommend to visit if you are by any chance in Suly city. You can visit it in any season. Winter is cold and lots of snowing, spring is amazingly green and autumn is typical yellowish and beautiful with walnut and pomegranate collection time.
You can visit or hike to it with friends and family.
Interesting Kurdish folk restaurants are available between Tawela and Byara towns.

title: Beautiful scenes and mountains
text: Beautiful area to visit in Hawraman part of Iraqi Kurdistan. At the end of Awesar, you will come across Iranian-Iraqi borders marked by a stone. Valley full of walnut trees and nice views from mountains around to hike or go by a car. I put some photos of January and July months.

title: Beautiful place for hiking
text:
Hawar village is an ancient center of a 14th century religion “Yarsan or Kakai”.
Very beautiful to hike around with family and friends, just be careful about not crossing border to Iran. There is a location called “Kuna Jnoka” where stones are carved by nature at old Hawar village, worth visiting along the stream.

title: Sahraa Cave in Chami Razan
text:
Very nice nature and beautiful trees.
We hiked up to a Sahraa Cave, that’s half hour away waking from main road, you need a guide, the cave has a very narrow entry and easy to miss in this mountainous area.
Better to be minimum three persons and with a guide. Don’t enter it alone.
Take headlamp with you and water proof clothes, expect muddy areas inside and in some places you need to crawl on your chest for several meters.
Unfortunately inside the cave, people draw lots of graphite inside.
Wish all a safe journey

title: Gechkar Cave
text:
Piramagrun mountain have very beautiful places to visit as it has several valleys from many sides of it.
One valley from Swse village leads to a very beautiful nature valley with an interesting cave, Gechkar cave, where you need a guide with you to find it and you need headlamp and proper hiking shoes and water proof clothes.
Expect 5-7 hours hiking according to your group speed.

title: Rabana Valley, Beautiful nature and interesting ancient ruins
text:
We hiked to Rabana valley and PlaChawra cave, this place is close to Merquli rock-relief but can’t be done in same day because of difficult terrains and roads that lead to each of them.
It’s an easy to moderate hiking and nature is beautiful and untouched in this valley. There are ancient ruins of Rabana fortress wall, Rabana rock-relief and Rabana sanctuary complex staircase and steps. They date back to 50-150 AC and built by Parthian empire

title: Nice hiking
text:
Very beautiful canyon with lots of roads leading to different paths. So be careful to have a guide or a local from that area with you so as not to get lost.
It’s good hike for 7-10 hours and nice water stream running along the mid of the pathway.

title: Nice walking area
text:
Nice walking area along the woods of Goizha mountain.
Unfortunately people go to picnic in this area and they leave their rubbish behind. We also collected several bags.
We hope the municipality takes action to prevent such behaviors.

title: A natural wonder
text:
This beautiful canyon is a real natural wonder is located between Darbandikhan and Kalar town and it’s created naturally by water and wind.
You must visit it with guide or a local as you can get lost easily and you should avoid entering this canyon or valleys during raining seasons as it’s fragile and stones can fall. So better to go during summer.
Hiking around this area can last between 7-10 hours.

title: Nice hiking up to the castle
text:
We did a nice hiking for 2 hours to reach the top of this mountain where there is an ancient 15 century castle ruins.
There is a very refreshing water fountain at the base of the castle.
Take plenty of water if you go during summer. However best month to go is during autumn or spring.

title: Must see
text: The center and the old town of Slemani city, you can find multiple and different types of shops, cafeterias and restaurants. It’s nice to walk around this area.

title: Difficult but very interesting hiking
text:
First don’t go alone as there are no markings where the rock relief is located. You need a local villager or a guide with you.

An interesting rock relief that dates back to first millenium BC in Piramagrun mountain.
It’s a very difficult hiking on a steeply mountain and can take around 3 hours to reach the rock relief and remnants of a citadel and walls.

Take plenty water with you and sun protection (hat, sunglass, neck cover...etc).

title: Ancient ruins
text:
Ancient citadel ruins close to Darbandi Bazyan.
Nice to walk around and to see all these rooms and arches. Just be careful there is one water-well inside a room.
Used to be a church inside this citadel as they found some crosses and latter are exhibited in Slemani museum.

title: Interesting to see
text:
Around 30 minutes away from Slemani city, on highway to Kirkuk.
Interesting and beautiful to walk around and see monuments and mountains.
Suitable for family visit too.

title: Beautiful green park
text:
Very nice garden in the mid of the busiest part of Slemani city.
Free entry and open 24 hours.
Nice for a walk with family or friends.

title: Nice green park
text:
Beautiful green park in the middle of Slemani city. Contains several gardens and amusement park.
Good for walking and jogging.

title: Beautiful large park
text: A beautiful large green park over an area of more than 1000 acre. Close to Slemani city. Family friendly area. Good to have a walk around.

title: Very good hotel
text:
Very good hotel, friendly staff, good breakfast.
Convenient for business meetings too.
Ask for rooms with park view.
Good location and close to citadel.
It’s located in Gulan street which has many good restaurants and cafeterias around.

title: Interesting to see
text:
A beautiful cultural museum in Mawlawi Street, downtown of Slemani city.
Worth visiting with friends or family.

title: Beautiful lake and nature
text:
Beautiful nature around this lake and it’s perfect to visit this area during spring and autumn. Good for family travels.
This area is famous for its variety of wildlife.

title: Remnants of a historical tower
text:
Easy to reach with car. It’s close to Barkal Village between Darbandikhan and Qaradagh area.
You can have a nice walk around.
Lots of big rocks remnants of this tower is scattered around. The rocks with scripts or texts are preserved in Slemani museum.

title: Difficult hike but incredibly beautiful
text:
4200 years old Akkadian Rock-Relief on a cliff of a mountain in Derbandi Belula close to DarbandiKhan town.
Expect difficult hiking, wear comfortable shoes and take plenty of water as it can be hot especially in summer.
You need a local guide or a professional hiker with you. Don’t try to go alone as it may be difficult to reach or find it.

title: Good for hiking
text:
A very nice valley with water stream in between mountains. Very good for hiking and climbing.
Just as any other place in nature, don’t go alone and have a local guide with you.

title: Must see
text:
This beautiful ancient Assyrian aqueduct site was built by the Assyrian king Sennacherib between 703 and 690 BC to water Ninevah's extensive gardens.

Worth visiting if you are around Lalish or Duhok.

title: Must go
text: If you are in Slemani town, then you must go to the top of this mountain that overlooks the city by car (20 minutes) or by hiking or by cable card from chavi land.

title: Beautiful Rocky Mountain
text:
A 2611 meters hight beautiful rocky mountain overlooking Slemani city.
Never hike alone to there. It’s difficult and you can get lost very easily.
There are local hiking groups who go to the mountain few times a year in different seasons.

title: Beautiful waterfall
text:
An incredible waterfall hidden between the valleys and mountains of Hawraman region. Highly recommend to visit if you are in Slemani city. One and half hour away by driving and pater easy climbing.
Good for shopping some local products too.

title: Beautiful and touristic location
text:
A river flowing from Dukan lake with lots of touristic houses or villas to stay overnight.
Nice to hike to some mountains.
Very busy during weekends during spring time.
Weather is best during spring and autumn. It can be hot in summer.

title: Beautiful area to visit
text: Beautiful green mountains and valleys to visit especially during Spring time. There are lots of caves around and Cyaxares tomb too.

title: Beautiful old royal tomb
text:
A beautiful old (around 600 BC) royal tomb of probably king Cyaxares, who was the third and most capable king of Media.
Easy hiking, even for young kids.
Beautiful area and mountains.
Just unfortunately some people ruined it by making some drawings or wrote some texts over this ancient place.

title: Historical and beautiful nature
text:
Beautiful nature, valley, mountains and rock relief to visit.
Easy to moderate hiking. Rocks can be slippery if raining.
Wear comfortable hiking shoes.
Can be hot in summer.
1 hour and 30 minutes away from Slemani by driving.

title: Delicious food
text:
Very good restaurant, they serve local Kurdish food. They have different varieties of rice, stews, kifta and dolma (yaprakh).
They serve also different meat types like turkey, rooster, deer meat, sheep and ostrich meat.
It’s cozy, affordable, clean and must go if you are in Suly

title: Must see
text:
A beautiful fourteenth century island castle, must see if you are in Vilnius.
You can also take a balloon tour over the area.

title: Must see
text: It’s one of the must see objects in Prague, beautiful 600 years old clock. Although it’s always very busy around it, but better to see it at least one time when clock strikes an hour.
place: Old Town Hall with Astronomical Clock

title: Beautiful tower
text: In a walking distance from old town, Easy to walk to this beautiful old tower bridge. Nice river and castle view too.

title: Beautiful scenery
text: Nice to walk to and beautiful scenery when you reach top of the castle to see Prague from a higher ground

title: Interesting to see
text:
An old security headquarter of Baath party in Suly, where in 1980s security forces where prisoning and torturing people. It reminds of Nazi or Soviet torturing places with small prison cells.
There is another section in this building where they demonstrate Kurdish local dress designs. Nice idea to make beautiful cultural show beside this tragic place.

title: Beautiful waterfall
text:
Beautiful waterfall where water is flowing down from the center of a mountain.
Be careful if you are climbing up as it can be very slippery.

title: Beautiful lake
text:
Beautiful artificial lake surrounded by mighty mountains. There is a good hotel (Ashur) to stay overnight or to do some water activities.
There are good restaurants around.
It has a very good road from Suly city. Around 40 minutes away.
Nice to visit it in all seasons except summer because of heat.

title: Easy to access it and beautiful scenes
text:
Very easy to access it by car and easy hike to it from parking area. Its cold and windy area even in summer because it’s located between mountains.

Some historical facts:
This cave is 50 km west of Slemani city, in Surdash area. It’s located behind Kani Khan Village.
On 1923, after battle with British army, King Mahmood Hafid was forced to leave Slemani city and move to Surdash area and made this cave his hide-out and headquarter.
This cave witnessed issuing first edition of “Bangi Haq” newspaper.

title: Interesting architect
text: Great to walk around this interestingly modern architect bridge close to old and classical part of Tbilisi. You can also use near by funicular.
